page.title: 10Past and Present in our Area
page.content: There are some historic buildings to be found in our area to the north of the town. Mains Castle, built around 1500 AD, fell into disrepair and be- came a ruin. Now it has been renovated and restored and is lived in as a private house as was shown on a recent television documentary. Lymekilns is a building with a very different fate. Until recently this large house with about 12 stables was used as a riding school but with the plans for house building in the area it has had to close to be demolished. Castle Hill and Rough Hill are both fortified sites but nowadays there is little to see. The best links with the past are to be found in the village; the Montgomerie Arms built in 1719 and still in use, with the skyline of the area dominated by the clock tower of the parish church built in 1774.
